items.title: BBC News app
items.summary: Top stories, breaking news, live reporting, and follow news topics that match your interests

items.title: China says U.S. TikTok deal a 'win-win', will review app's technology and IP transfers
Masood Azhar’s family ‘torn into pieces’ in India’s Operation Sindoor in Pakistan: JeM commander
items.summary: JeM commander Ilyas Kashmiri can be heard in a viral video fuming over the Indian attack that killed the family members of Azhar during Operation Sindoor

items.title: University of California students, professors and staff sue the Trump administration
items.summary: The lawsuit comes weeks after the Trump administration fined the University of California, Los Angeles $1.2 billion and froze research funding after accusing the school of allowing antisemitism on campus

items.title: Morning Digest: Trump wishes ‘friend’ PM Modi on his birthday; Charlie Kirk killing suspect faces death penalty for aggravated murder charge, and more
items.summary: Here is a select list of stories to start the day.

items.title: Medical staffer alleges rape inside Bengal hospital, accused arrested
items.summary: The Police arrests the prime accused Zahir Abbas Khan; multiple complaints have surfaced against him

items.title: Rajasthan surpasses target for millet outlets in rural areas
items.summary: Rajasthan Government exceeds target, establishes 152 millet outlets to promote nutritious and sustainable food options in rural areas

items.title: Anti-climax of Pudukottai Lok Sabha bye-election in 1995 when Thirunavukkarasar was a ‘common candidate’
items.summary: The Pudukottai episode, according to Mr. Thirunavukkarasar, had caused a considerable gap between him and Karunanidhi. However, three years later, he and Karunanidhi patched up and the former went on to become an MP from the same constituency.

items.title: Woman held for snatching gold chain from septuagenarian
Residents cheer opening of two high-level bridges across Then Pennai river in Tiruvannamalai
Stalin flags shortage of fertilizers, requests Centre for allotting supplies
TNSTC buses display ‘Be kind to Animal’ slogan
items.summary: TNSTC officials said that bright blue colour has been selected for these stickers to enhance the readability among commuters and passersby

items.title: A failed attempt of train sabotage by railway employees in Madras 60 years ago
items.summary: According to an article by S. Nagalingam, Superintendent of Police, Special Branch, CID, Madras in the October-December 1965 edition of The Madras Police Journal, all the three accused were found guilty.

items.title: Tripura Government cancels licence of controversial Bar Club in Agartala
items.summary: West Tripura District Magistrate said there was no permission given for organising a DJ party in the bar adjacent to the Rabindra Bhavan, which is attributed as a cultural landmark in Agartala city

items.title: Former CM Naveen Patnaik expresses deep anguish over sexual assault on women in Odisha
items.summary: The five-time Chief Minister condemns gang rape near Puri temple and criticises BJP’s failure to ensure women’s safety

items.title: Maoists offer to lay down arms in a letter; verifying, says Chhattisgarh Government
items.summary: A purported letter from the banned Communist Party of India (Maoist) offers to give up arms and seeks peace talks with the government amid conditions

items.title: Constitutional, religious concerns remain unaddressed in Supreme Court’s interim order: Mirwaiz Umar Farooq
items.summary: Muttahida Majlis-e-Ulema demanded that the top court urgently take up the matter for a final hearing and safeguard the constitutional and religious rights of Muslims

items.title: Ahmednagar railway station renamed Ahilyanagar
items.summary: Ahmednagar railway station renamed Ahilyanagar to Honour Lokmata Devi Ahilya Bai Holkar, in sync with district name

items.title: Rajasthan High Court accepts ACB’s closure report in government toppling case
items.summary: The  Anti-Corruption Bureau report stated that there was no evidence of bribery, horse-trading, or political conspiracy in the intercepted phone calls which formed the basis of the case

items.title: Madhya Pradesh woman constable beaten to death by husband with baseball bat
items.summary: The Police official says the accused, Virendra Saket, fled the spot after the alleged crime and is currently on the run

items.title: Court denies bail to two accused in Mirwaiz Moulvi Farooq’s assassination case
items.summary: Bail applications of the accused in Mirwaiz Moulvi Farooq assassination dismissed by TADA Court; accused avoided law enforcement for years

items.title: Apple stocks dumped in ditches, as key highway remains closed for third week in Kashmir
items.summary: Officials said a 300-metre patch in Udhampur was proving to be a major challenge for the authorities. The area has witnessed landslips and land subsidence in the past three weeks

items.title: Trump arrives in Britain for unprecedented second state visit
items.summary: U.S. President Trump arrives in Britain for second state visit, invited by King Charles III

items.title: After Indore, patients allege rat bites at Jabalpur medical college; probe launched
items.summary: Jabalpur Collector Raghvendra Singh said that the district administration has issued notices to hospital authorities, seeking a status report on the incident within three days

items.title: HC extends parole of farmer convicted in murder to save farm inundated by floods

items.summary: The drought has slashed wheat harvests by 40% in a country where nearly 90% of the population already lives in poverty.

items.title: 'It took 20 years but I brought my rapist to justice'

items.title: Hyderabad rains: Afzal Sagar erased, flash floods now fill the void
items.summary: Once a major lake, it has vanished under decades of encroachment and neglect; with its natural drainage lost, the area repeatedly faces heavy flooding, the latest having swept away two youth

items.title: SC youth in love with daughter of inter-caste couple murdered near Mayiladuthurai; special team formed to nab suspects

items.summary: If the copper plates were indeed cladded with gold, records must exist documenting the same, including the exact quantity of gold used, since traditional methods were followed.

items.title: Walkathon held to raise awareness on World Ozone Day
items.summary: The event was inaugurated by Seema Agrawal, Director General of Tamil Nadu Fire and Rescue Services, who stressed the need for sustainable practices to protect the ozone layer.

items.title: Two persons killed as speeding car hits motorcycles near Vanagaram
items.summary: According to the police, the car’s driver was in a panic as he rammed an autorickshaw moments before causing the other accidents. He was caught after a chase. A medical examination, however, revealed that it was not a case of drunk driving

items.title: 'The ego has landed' and 'Don in... none out'
items.summary: Donald Trump's arrival in the UK and the blocked removal of a migrant to France lead the papers.

items.summary: PM Modi said he supports the U.S.’ initiatives towards a peaceful resolution of the Ukraine conflict and also aims to strengthen U.S.-India relations

China urges U.S. & Japan to withdraw Typhon missile system

items.summary: It questions the rationale behind not releasing district-wise, caste-wise cut-offs and denying postings to some candidates who have been issued call letters

items.title: Taliban leader bans WIFI in an Afghan province to ‘prevent immorality’
items.summary: Haji Attaullah Zaid, a provincial government spokesperson, said there was no longer cable internet access in Balkh by order of a “complete ban” from the leader Hibatullah Akhundzada.

items.title: India-Pakistan border sees a sharp rise in drone-driven drug smuggling cases
items.summary: There has been a sharp increase in drone sightings and recoveries of narcotics in border districts such as Amritsar, Tarn Taran, Ferozpur and Gurdaspur

items.summary: Listing a medicine on the EML is one step in a series of actions that can lead to lower costs, better affordability, and greater access

items.summary: Of 333 total reported cases, 34 patients are undergoing treatment; all patients are stable and no deaths have been reported so far, says NTR District Collector

items.title: At UNHRC, India condemns violation of Qatar’s sovereignty

items.title:
Change in PMK’s registered address is an attempt to hoodwink people, says 
G.K. Mani
